body: @iavinas Thank you for using `--serve-artifacts`. You're likely seeing this error because the host running `mlflow server` does not have correct / sufficient credentials configured for writing files to Google Cloud Storage. Can you ensure that you've configured such credentials on your host and try again? Feel free to reopen this issue if that does not resolve it.
Yes, the mlflow server pod has admin access to GCS. Manually I can read and write files from the pod using google-cloud-storage.
@iavinas Can you share a complete traceback for the error?

Hi, @dbczumar yesterday I deleted all the old mlflow==1.21.0 artifacts from my bucket and all projects from the interface. Now I am getting this error I try to call log_artifacts("outputs").

In the URL port is None instead of 80 or nothing.




`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 384, in prepare_url
    scheme, auth, host, port, path, query, fragment = parse_url(url)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/urllib3/util/url.py", line 394, in parse_url
    return six.raise_from(LocationParseError(source_url), None)
  File "<string>", line 3, in raise_from
urllib3.exceptions.LocationParseError: Failed to parse: https://mlflow.mydomain.com:None/api/2.0/mlflow-artifacts/artifacts/16/eeb1862526c74c14994af6c71a8a2512/artifacts/a.txt

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/iavinas/mlflow/test/example.py", line 44, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/iavinas/mlflow/test/example.py", line 30, in main
    mlflow.log_artifact(tmp_path_a)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 606, in log_artifact
    MlflowClient().log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 955, in log_artifact
    self._tracking_client.log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 355, in log_artifact
    artifact_repo.log_artifact(local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/http_artifact_repo.py", line 29, in log_artifact
    resp = self._session.put(url, data=f, timeout=600)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 589, in put
    return self.request('PUT', url, data=data, **kwargs)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 515, in request
    prep = self.prepare_request(req)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 443, in prepare_request
    p.prepare(
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 318, in prepare
    self.prepare_url(url, params)
  File "/home/iavinas/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 386, in prepare_url
    raise InvalidURL(*e.args)
requests.exceptions.InvalidURL: Failed to parse: https://mlflow.mydomain.com:None/api/2.0/mlflow-artifacts/artifacts/16/eeb1862526c74c14994af6c71a8a2512/artifacts/a.txt`

Can confirm, we're currently trying out `--serve-artifacts` too and are facing the same problem. Access isn't the issue since without the flag and only using `-default-artifact-root` works without any problems (but the client needs GCS authentication which we're trying to avoid).

@iavinas @D3nn3 Thank you for the clarification. Can you try installing MLflow from the `master` branch? E.g `pip install git+https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow@master`. https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/5385 was recently merged, which should fix this issue.

Thank your for the fast answer @dbczumar 

Didn't seem to solve the issue on our end, still get the same error:

`InvalidURL: Failed to parse: http://some-url.com:None/api/2.0/mlflow-artifacts/artifacts/5/f3b7a5a8d58941179ba3208730276cdd/artifacts/training_args.bin`

Here is how we start the server:

```
mlflow server \
    --host=$MLFLOW_HOST \
    --port=$MLFLOW_PORT \
    --workers=$MLFLOW_WORKERS \
    --artifacts-destination="gs://project-name/artifact-store" \
    --backend-store-uri=$MLFLOW_BACKEND_STORE_URI \
    --serve-artifacts
```

@D3nn3 Can you confirm that you're running the installation from `master` by checking `mlflow.__version__`? It should say `1.23.1.dev0`. I was able to reproduce the `:None` issue on 1.23.1, but it seems to be fixed on `master`.

It's a bit tricky to verify since we're building docker images and deploying them in Kubernetes.

Output from the CI when building the docker image:
```
Collecting git+https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow@master
  Cloning https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow (to revision master) to /tmp/pip-req-build-agcq3edk
  Running command git clone -q https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow /tmp/pip-req-build-agcq3edk
  Resolved https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow to commit e8db119cc0d5081eea0b06e5b26c94a7193e7336
  Installing build dependencies: started
```

This is the used commit which seems about right: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/commit/e8db119cc0d5081eea0b06e5b26c94a7193e7336

Additionally the UI on the deployed service doesn't work anymore and this is the error messages shown in the browser:

```
Unable to display MLflow UI - landing page (index.html) not found.

You are very likely running the MLflow server using a source installation of the Python MLflow
package.

...
```

I assume everything was deployed correctly @dbczumar API endpoints work at least.

@D3nn3 For UI you have to do this either while building docker or before starting Docker build.
`cd mlflow/server/js && \
    npm install && \
    npm run build`
